content:
A mixture of Co(NO3)2·H2O (1 mmol, 0.291g), 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid (H3BTC; 0.5 mmol, 0.105 g), triethylamine (TEA; 1 mL), and 4 mL of nonanoic acid was put into a 23 mL autoclave and heated at 160 °C for 6 days. Then, the reaction was naturally cooled and washed with acetone to give purple-black bar crystals of NTU-Z30 (see the photograph of Figure S1a, ). Yield: 80% (based on H3BTC). EA and ICP analysis for Co4C54H62N3O26 (1404.79): Co, 16.92; C, 46.08; H, 4.55; N, 3.05 (calcd: Co, 16.80; C, 46.13; H, 4.41; N, 2.99). IR (KBr pellet): 676(vs), 719(s), 758(s), 823(s), 879(s), 939(s), 1051(s), 1099(s), 1186(m), 1249(m), 1367(m), 1441(m), 1492(s), 1561(m), 1613(m), 1635(m), 1721(m), 2857(s), 2926(s), 3017(s), 3415(vs).

<bold>NTU-Z31</bold> and <bold>NTU-Z32</bold>

A synthesis procedure similar to that for preparing NTU-Z30 has been adopted but with a difference ratio of raw materials. For NTU-Z31, a mixture of Co(NO3)2·H2O (0. 5 mmol, 0.145 g), H3BTC (1 mmol, 0.210 g), TEA (2.5 mL), and 2.5 mL of nonanoic acid was employed, and red bar crystals of NTU-Z31 (see the photograph of Figure S1b, ) were obtained in 70% yield (based on H3BTC). EA and ICP analysis for CoC15H21NO7 (386.26): Co, 15.21; C, 46.53; H, 1.55; N, 4.17 (calcd: Co, 15.27; C, 46.60; H, 1.41; N, 4.26). IR (KBr pellet): 685(vs), 715(s), 762(s), 827(s), 874(s), 1048(vs), 1181(vs), 1259(s), 1367(m), 1436(m), 1492(s), 1561(m), 1618(m), 1696(s), 2491(vs), 2680(s), 2857(s), 2926(s), 3112(vs), 3411(vs). For NTU- Z32, a mixture of Co(NO3)2·H2O (0.5 mmol, 0.145 g), H3BTC (0.5 mmol, 0.105 g), TEA (1 mL), and 4 mL of nonanoic acid was used, and purple prism crystals of NTU-Z32 were obtained (see the photograph of Figure S1c, ). Yield: 80% (based on H3BTC). EA and ICP analysis for Co3C60H76N4O24 (1414.04): Co, 12.56; C, 50.97; H, 5.17; N, 4.07 (calcd: Co, 12.52; C, 50.92; H, 5.37; N, 3.96). IR (KBr pellet): 685(vs), 715(s), 762(s), 1181(s), 1259(s), 1367(m), 1432(m), 1488(s), 1561(m), 1622(m), 1691(s), 2491(vs), 2676(s), 2737(vs), 2857(vs), 2931(s), 2983(s), 3112(s), 3411(vs).

Catalytic Epoxidation

The epoxidation of different alkenes involving O2 gas was performed in a three-neck glass flask equipped with a stirring bar and a reflux condenser. Typically, 2.5 mg of NTU-Z30, 1 mmol of substrate, and 15 mL of N,N′-dimethylformamide (DMF) were charged into the above flask. Under vigorous stirring, the mixture was heated to the desired reaction temperature and a stream of O2 gas (30 mL min–1) was bubbled into the glass flask to initiate epoxidation.
clean_text:
Synthesis of MOFs

 NTU-Z30 

A mixture of Co(NO3)2⋅H2O (1 mmol, 0.291g), 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid (H3BTC; 0.5 mmol, 0.105 g), triethylamine (TEA; 1 mL), and 4 mL of nonanoic acid was put into a 23 mL autoclave and heated at 160 °C for 6 days. Then, the reaction was naturally cooled and washed with acetone to give purple-black bar crystals of NTU-Z30 (see the photograph of Figure S1a, ). Yield: 80% (based on H3BTC). EA and ICP analysis for Co4C54H62N3O26 (1404.79): Co, 16.92; C, 46.08; H, 4.55; N, 3.05 (calcd: Co, 16.80; C, 46.13; H, 4.41; N, 2.99). IR (KBr pellet): 676(vs), 719(s), 758(s), 823(s), 879(s), 939(s), 1051(s), 1099(s), 1186(m), 1249(m), 1367(m), 1441(m), 1492(s), 1561(m), 1613(m), 1635(m), 1721(m), 2857(s), 2926(s), 3017(s), 3415(vs).

 NTU-Z31 and NTU-Z32 

A synthesis procedure similar to that for preparing NTU-Z30 has been adopted but with a difference ratio of raw materials. For NTU-Z31, a mixture of Co(NO3)2⋅H2O (0. 5 mmol, 0.145 g), H3BTC (1 mmol, 0.210 g), TEA (2.5 mL), and 2.5 mL of nonanoic acid was employed, and red bar crystals of NTU-Z31 (see the photograph of Figure S1b, ) were obtained in 70% yield (based on H3BTC). EA and ICP analysis for CoC15H21NO7 (386.26): Co, 15.21; C, 46.53; H, 1.55; N, 4.17 (calcd: Co, 15.27; C, 46.60; H, 1.41; N, 4.26). IR (KBr pellet): 685(vs), 715(s), 762(s), 827(s), 874(s), 1048(vs), 1181(vs), 1259(s), 1367(m), 1436(m), 1492(s), 1561(m), 1618(m), 1696(s), 2491(vs), 2680(s), 2857(s), 2926(s), 3112(vs), 3411(vs). For NTU- Z32, a mixture of Co(NO3)2⋅H2O (0.5 mmol, 0.145 g), H3BTC (0.5 mmol, 0.105 g), TEA (1 mL), and 4 mL of nonanoic acid was used, and purple prism crystals of NTU-Z32 were obtained (see the photograph of Figure S1c, ). Yield: 80% (based on H3BTC). EA and ICP analysis for Co3C60H76N4O24 (1414.04): Co, 12.56; C, 50.97; H, 5.17; N, 4.07 (calcd: Co, 12.52; C, 50.92; H, 5.37; N, 3.96). IR (KBr pellet): 685(vs), 715(s), 762(s), 1181(s), 1259(s), 1367(m), 1432(m), 1488(s), 1561(m), 1622(m), 1691(s), 2491(vs), 2676(s), 2737(vs), 2857(vs), 2931(s), 2983(s), 3112(s), 3411(vs).

Catalytic Epoxidation

The epoxidation of different alkenes involving O2 gas was performed in a three-neck glass flask equipped with a stirring bar and a reflux condenser. Typically, 2.5 mg of NTU-Z30, 1 mmol of substrate, and 15 mL of N,N'-dimethylformamide (DMF) were charged into the above flask. Under vigorous stirring, the mixture was heated to the desired reaction temperature and a stream of O2 gas (30 mL min-1) was bubbled into the glass flask to initiate epoxidation.
